config.title: Blood pressure quiz
config.intro_copy:
Around 30% of people in England have high blood pressure but many don't know it. If left untreated, high blood pressure increases your risk of a heart attack or stroke.
It's important to know what affects our blood pressure and what you can do to keep your blood pressure at a healthy level.
Take this short quiz and see how much you know.
config.intro_copy_alt:
Around 30% of people in England have high blood pressure (hypertension) but many don't know it. If left untreated, high blood pressure increases your risk of a heart attack or stroke.

It's important to know what affects our blood pressure and what you can do to keep your blood pressure at a healthy level.

Take this short quiz and see how much you know.

q.title: New question
q.body: How many people do you think have high blood pressure in England? Select one:

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false? 

'If you don’t have any symptoms you don’t need a blood pressure test'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?
 
'If high blood pressure runs in your family there is nothing you can do to stop developing high blood pressure yourself.'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?

'If you have high blood pressure you will need to take medication for life.'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?

'I don’t add extra salt to my food so my blood pressure can’t be high.'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false?

'If a man is obese he is 4 times more likely to develop high blood pressure.'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false? 

'I had my blood pressure checked around 5 years ago so I know my blood pressure is low'

q.title: New question
q.body:
Do you think the following statement is true or false? 

'You need to make an appointment and see your GP to get a blood pressure test.'

q.title: New question
q.body: What conditions can high blood pressure lead to? You can pick more than one:

q.title: New question
q.body: What factors are known to increase the risk of developing high blood pressure? You can pick more than one.

a.body: Too much salt in your diet
Family history of high blood pressure

results.ri: Oh dear. You don't know very much about blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health. Here is an overview of the blood pressure facts:
Well done, you know quite a bit about blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health. Here is an overview of the blood pressure facts:
Brilliant! You really know your stuff when it comes to blood pressure. The more you know, the better you can protect your health. Here is an overview of the blood pressure facts:

All of the factors listed in the final question play an important role in your blood pressure. Making simple lifestyle changes can reduce your risk, such as:
  • Eating a heart-healthy diet which is calorie-balanced and rich in fruit and vegetables
  • Limiting the amount of salt in your diet
  • Enjoying regular physical activity
  • Maintaining a healthy weight
  • Managing your stress levels
  • Limiting the amount of alcohol you drink

links.li: With high blood pressure affecting over a quarter of all adults in England it is important that everyone takes the time to get checked and to take action to lower their risk. Here are some links to articles that you might find useful:

result_items.ri: You were wrong. In fact, more than 1 in 4 people in England have high blood pressure. It is one of the biggest causes of premature death and disability.
You were wrong. In fact, more than 1 in 4 people in England have high blood pressure. It is one of the biggest causes of premature death and disability.
You were wrong. In fact, more than 1 in 4 people in England have high blood pressure. It is one of the biggest causes of premature death and disability.
You were right. More than 1 in 4 (a quarter) of people in England have high blood pressure. It is one of the biggest causes of premature death and disability.
You were wrong. High blood pressure doesn't usually cause symptoms and the only way to know is if you get tested. This is why it is often known as the ‘silent killer'.
You were right. High blood pressure doesn't usually cause symptoms and the only way to know is if you get tested. This is why it is often known as the ‘silent killer'.
You were wrong. If high blood pressure runs in your family you're more likely to develop it but you can still reduce your risk by maintaining a healthy weight and eating a balanced diet.
You were right. If high blood pressure runs in your family you're more likely to develop it but you can still reduce your risk by maintaining a healthy weight and eating a balanced diet.

You were wrong. A diagnosis of high blood pressure does not necessarily mean that you need to begin on medication. Lifestyle changes such as a healthier diet or more physical activity can significantly lower it without medication.

You were right. A diagnosis of high blood pressure does not necessarily mean that you need to begin on medication. Lifestyle changes such as a healthier diet or more physical activity can significantly lower it without medication.

You were wrong. About 75% of the salt we consume is hidden in processed foods like bread, breakfast cereal and ready meals. Although cutting down on salt will reduce blood pressure, it is not the only cause.

You were right. About 75% of the salt we consume is hidden in processed foods like bread, breakfast cereal and ready meals. Although cutting down on salt will reduce blood pressure, it is not the only cause.
You were right. Obesity affects around a quarter of adults in England. Obesity multiplies the risk of developing high blood pressure about fourfold in men and almost threefold in women.
You were wrong. Obesity affects around a quarter of adults in England. Obesity multiplies the risk of developing high blood pressure about fourfold in men and almost threefold in women.

You were wrong. Your blood pressure can fluctuate which is why all adults should get tested at least every 5 years. Those more at risk such as people of African or Caribbean descent, older people or people who are overweight or obese, should be checked more regularly.

You were right. Your blood pressure can fluctuate which is why all adults should get tested at least every 5 years. Those more at risk such as people of African or Caribbean descent, older people or people who are overweight or obese, should be checked more regularly.

You were wrong. You don't have to see your GP to get a blood pressure test. Nurses or healthcare assistants can test you, some surgeries have self-service machines, many pharmacies offer free tests and you can even buy accurate monitors to use at home. If you are between 40 – 74 years old, you could get your blood pressure tested through the free NHS Health Check programme.

You were right. You don't have to see your GP to get a blood pressure test. Nurses or healthcare assistants can test you, some surgeries have self-service machines, many pharmacies offer free tests and you can even buy accurate monitors to use at home. If you are between 40 – 74 years old, you could get your blood pressure tested through the free NHS Health Check programme.
You correctly identified that high blood pressure can lead to a heart attack.
You correctly identified that high blood pressure can lead to stroke.
You correctly identified that high blood pressure can lead to kidney disease.
You correctly identified that high blood pressure can lead to dementia.
